result.execSummary:
The defendant Antwan Earl Shockley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery to Injunction Petitioner [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1m)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court advised defendant  that as a convicted felon he must provide  a DNA sample, his voting rights are suspended and he may never possess firearms.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one.  Credit for 39 days.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Antwan Earl Shockley in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  Defendant Antwan Earl Shockley in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNTS 2, 4 AND 5:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charges dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
.
AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 3:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 36 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prison, consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 39 days served.  Court ordered 12 MONTHS Initial Term Of Confinement and 24 MONTHS Extended Supervision.
Court found defendant not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Earned Release Programs.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations of the law.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Referral to the Mental Health Unit, Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim during the entire sentence unless approved by agent.
- 3rd party contact for the purpose of child visitation.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
AS TO COUNT 3:  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent with Count 1 with credit for 39 days time served. 

Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence. 
.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon s/he must provide a DNA sample, his/her voting rights are suspended and s/he may never possess firearms.

Attorney Matthew Russell Meyer in court.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Scheduling Conference held off the record.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Antwan Earl Shockley in court with attorney Mathew Mark Meyer.  Defendant Antwan Earl Shockley in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police department officer Derek Ertl.   Exhibits 1 and 2 recieved. State rests.  Defense rests.  On motion of the State, exhibits 1 and 2 withdrawn. Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect. Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: Shayna B. or her children  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Antwan Earl Shockley in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Antwan Earl Shockley in custody.  
Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.

Motion to dismiss by the defense the to Strike the  "Repeater Enhancers" on all 5 counts, GRANTED by the Court.
AMENDED:  On the State's motion, court orders complaint amended to reflect the correct date of June 15, 2007.

Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
